intro: Cremanthodium daochengense, commonly known as the Daocheng goldencup, is a rare flowering plant native to the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments at high elevations. Its small, hairy leaves and showy inflorescences make it distinctive in its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
